issues.title: Need Report for Who has What Permissions to all Repos in an Account
issues.content:
This feature request comes from [BBS-1966](https://support.atlassian.com/browse/BBS-1966) where I asked:

> How can I remove someone from ALL repos across 3 orgs? We just let someone go and we have many repos but didn't use group access rights initially. It will take hours to go through all of them and make sure they no longer have access. Is there a way to remove a user in bulk?

To which was replied:

> Sorry to say this isn't possible. This was the intention of creating group access rights. Going forward, if you have someone in a group, this shouldn't be an issue. Sadly I don't even have a way to do this efficiently.

To which I replied: 

> Can I suggest it would be very helpful to add tools that allow us to query repos and see who is on what repo and to bulk move a user from individual repos and add them to a group? If you did that it would make transitioning to groups much easier so more organizations would be able to use them more quickly.

To which I was told to add a ticket here. Which I did. :)

issues.title: Subrepository changeset links are broken (BB-4882)
issues.content:
If you go to a repository that contain subrepositories, such as

* https://bitbucket.org/tortoisehg/thg-build/src

then you see nice links to the subrepos. The links to the subrepos themselves are fine, but the links to the changesets (the link in square brackets) has a doubled slashes:

* https://bitbucket.org/abderrahim/dulwich//changeset/71b73697d24b

Clicking the link gives a 404 error.

The spacing between subrepo name and the square brackets is also inconsistent: if the subrepo revision is not a link, the leading space is missing.

issues.title: Certificate not trusted on Chrome
issues.content:
Does anyony knows why this happens? I have to open bitbucket.org on Firefox or Safari then go back do Chrome to make it work.

Something in my network?

"The site's security certificate is not trusted!
You attempted to reach bitbucket.org, but the server presented a certificate issued by an entity that is not trusted by your computer's operating system. This may mean that the server has generated its own security credentials, which Google Chrome cannot rely on for identity information, or an attacker may be trying to intercept your communications.
You cannot proceed because the website operator has requested heightened security for this domain."

Opening in Firefox or Safari also makes a security dialog appears, but it lets me accept the exception and go forward.

Thanks!

issues.title: Customizable default priority for issue reporting
issues.content: It would be very useful to have an option to set the default value for priority the same way you set default values for components, milestones and versions.
